verses.text: Now \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zeruiah|strong="H6870"\w* \w perceived|strong="H3045"\w* that the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* \add was\add* toward \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*.

And \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* to \w Tekoah|strong="H8620"\w*, and \w fetched|strong="H3947"\w* thence a \w wise|strong="H2450"\w* \w woman|strong="H0802"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto her, I pray thee, feign thyself to be a \w mourner|strong="H0056"\w*, and put \w on|strong="H3847"\w* now \w mourning|strong="H0060"\w* \w apparel|strong="H0899"\w*, and \w anoint|strong="H5480"\w* not thyself with \w oil|strong="H8081"\w*, but be as a \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* that had a \w long|strong="H7227"\w* \w time|strong="H3117"\w* \w mourned|strong="H0056"\w* for the \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*:

And \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* on this \w manner|strong="H1697"\w* unto him. So \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w put|strong="H7760"\w* the \w words|strong="H1697"\w* in her \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*.

¶ And when the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* of \w Tekoah|strong="H8621"\w* \w spake|strong="H0559"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, she \w fell|strong="H5307"\w* on her \w face|strong="H0639"\w* to the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w*, and did \w obeisance|strong="H7812"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Help|strong="H3467"\w*, O \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.\f + \fr 14.4 \ft Help: Heb. Save\f*

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto her, What aileth thee? And she \w answered|strong="H0559"\w*, I \add am\add* \w indeed|strong="H0061"\w* a \w widow|strong="H0490"\w* \w woman|strong="H0802"\w*, and mine \w husband|strong="H0376"\w* is \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*.

And thy \w handmaid|strong="H8198"\w* had \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w*, and they \w two|strong="H8147"\w* strove \w together|strong="H5327"\w* in the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, and \add there was\add* none to \w part|strong="H5337"\w* them, but the \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* the \w other|strong="H0259"\w*, and \w slew|strong="H4191"\w* him.\f + \fr 14.6 \ft none…: Heb. no deliverer between them\f*

And, behold, the whole \w family|strong="H4940"\w* is \w risen|strong="H6965"\w* against thine \w handmaid|strong="H8198"\w*, and they \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Deliver|strong="H5414"\w* him that \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* his \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*, that we may \w kill|strong="H4191"\w* him, for the \w life|strong="H5315"\w* of his \w brother|strong="H0251"\w* whom he \w slew|strong="H2026"\w*; and we will \w destroy|strong="H8045"\w* the \w heir|strong="H3423"\w* also: and so they shall \w quench|strong="H3518"\w* my \w coal|strong="H1513"\w* which is \w left|strong="H7760"\w*, and shall not \w leave|strong="H7604"\w* to my \w husband|strong="H0376"\w* \add neither\add* \w name|strong="H8034"\w* nor \w remainder|strong="H7611"\w* \w upon|strong="H6440"\w* the \w earth|strong="H0127"\w*.\f + \fr 14.7 \ft upon…: Heb. upon the face of the earth\f*

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w*, \w Go|strong="H3212"\w* to thine \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and I will give \w charge|strong="H6680"\w* concerning thee.

And the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* of \w Tekoah|strong="H8621"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, My \w lord|strong="H0113"\w*, O \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, the \w iniquity|strong="H5771"\w* \add be\add* on me, and on my \w father’s|strong="H0001"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*: and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* and his \w throne|strong="H3678"\w* \add be\add* \w guiltless|strong="H5355"\w*.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Whosoever \w saith|strong="H1696"\w* \add ought\add* unto thee, \w bring|strong="H0935"\w* him to me, and he shall not \w touch|strong="H5060"\w* thee any \w more|strong="H3254"\w*.

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* she, I pray thee, let the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w remember|strong="H2142"\w* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, that thou wouldest not suffer the \w revengers|strong="H1350"\w* of \w blood|strong="H1818"\w* to \w destroy|strong="H7843"\w* any \w more|strong="H7235"\w*, lest they \w destroy|strong="H8045"\w* my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*. And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \add As\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \w liveth|strong="H2416"\w*, there shall not one \w hair|strong="H8185"\w* of thy \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w fall|strong="H5307"\w* to the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*.  +  r 14.11  t that…: Heb. that the revenger of blood do not multiply to destroy *

Then the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Let thine \w handmaid|strong="H8198"\w*, I pray thee, \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* \add one\add* \w word|strong="H1697"\w* unto my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*. And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Say \w on|strong="H1696"\w*.

And the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Wherefore then hast thou \w thought|strong="H2803"\w* such a thing against the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*? for the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* doth \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* this \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* as one which is \w faulty|strong="H0818"\w*, in that the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* doth not fetch home \w again|strong="H7725"\w* his \w banished|strong="H5080"\w*.

For we must \w needs|strong="H4191"\w* \w die|strong="H4191"\w*, and \add are\add* as \w water|strong="H4325"\w* \w spilt|strong="H5064"\w* on the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w*, which cannot be gathered up \w again|strong="H0622"\w*; neither doth \w God|strong="H0430"\w* \w respect|strong="H5375"\w* \add any\add* \w person|strong="H5315"\w*: yet doth he \w devise|strong="H2803"\w* \w means|strong="H4284"\w*, that his \w banished|strong="H5080"\w* be not \w expelled|strong="H5080"\w* from him.\f + \fr 14.14 \ft neither…: or, because God hath not taken away his life, he hath also devised means, etc\f*

Now therefore that I am \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* of this \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* unto my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, \add it is\add* because the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* have made me \w afraid|strong="H3372"\w*: and thy \w handmaid|strong="H8198"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, I will now \w speak|strong="H1696"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*; it may be that the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* will \w perform|strong="H6213"\w* the \w request|strong="H1697"\w* of his \w handmaid|strong="H0519"\w*.

For the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* will \w hear|strong="H8085"\w*, to \w deliver|strong="H5337"\w* his \w handmaid|strong="H0519"\w* out of the \w hand|strong="H3709"\w* of the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \add that would\add* \w destroy|strong="H8045"\w* me and my \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w together|strong="H3162"\w* out of the \w inheritance|strong="H5159"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*.

Then thine \w handmaid|strong="H8198"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, The \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* shall now be \w comfortable|strong="H4496"\w*: for as an \w angel|strong="H4397"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, so \add is\add* my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* to \w discern|strong="H8085"\w* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* and \w bad|strong="H7451"\w*: therefore the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w* will be with thee.\f + \fr 14.17 \ft comfortable: Heb. for rest\f*\f + \fr 14.17 \ft to discern: Heb. to hear\f*

Then the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w*, \w Hide|strong="H3582"\w* not from me, I pray thee, the \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* that I shall \w ask|strong="H7592"\w* thee. And the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Let my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* now \w speak|strong="H1696"\w*.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \add Is not\add* the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* with thee in all this? And the \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* \w answered|strong="H6030"\w* and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \add As\add* thy \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* \w liveth|strong="H2416"\w*, my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, \w none|strong="H0376"\w* \w can|strong="H0786"\w* turn to the right \w hand|strong="H3231"\w* or to the \w left|strong="H8041"\w* from ought that my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* hath \w spoken|strong="H1696"\w*: for thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, he \w bade|strong="H6680"\w* me, and he \w put|strong="H7760"\w* all these \w words|strong="H1697"\w* in the \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w* of thine \w handmaid|strong="H8198"\w*:

\w To|strong="H5668"\w* fetch \w about|strong="H5437"\w* this \w form|strong="H6440"\w* of \w speech|strong="H1697"\w* hath thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w done|strong="H6213"\w* this \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*: and my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* \add is\add* \w wise|strong="H2450"\w*, according to the \w wisdom|strong="H2451"\w* of an \w angel|strong="H4397"\w* of \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, to \w know|strong="H3045"\w* all \add things\add* that \add are\add* in the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*.

¶ And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, Behold now, I have \w done|strong="H6213"\w* this \w thing|strong="H1697"\w*: \w go|strong="H3212"\w* therefore, \w bring|strong="H7725"\w* the young \w man|strong="H5288"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w again|strong="H7725"\w*.

And \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w fell|strong="H5307"\w* to the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w* on his \w face|strong="H6440"\w*, and \w bowed|strong="H7812"\w* himself, and \w thanked|strong="H1288"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*: and \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, To \w day|strong="H3117"\w* thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w* \w knoweth|strong="H3045"\w* that I have \w found|strong="H4672"\w* \w grace|strong="H2580"\w* in thy \w sight|strong="H5869"\w*, my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w*, O \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, in that the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* hath \w fulfilled|strong="H6213"\w* the \w request|strong="H1697"\w* of his \w servant|strong="H5650"\w*.\f + \fr 14.22 \ft thanked: Heb. blessed\f*\f + \fr 14.22 \ft his servant: or, thy servant\f*

So \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w arose|strong="H6965"\w* and \w went|strong="H3212"\w* to \w Geshur|strong="H1650"\w*, and \w brought|strong="H0935"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* to \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Let him \w turn|strong="H5437"\w* to his own \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and let him not \w see|strong="H7200"\w* my \w face|strong="H6440"\w*. So \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w returned|strong="H5437"\w* to his own \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* not the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w face|strong="H6440"\w*.

¶ But in all \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* there was \w none|strong="H0376"\w* to be so \w much|strong="H3966"\w* \w praised|strong="H1984"\w* as \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* for his \w beauty|strong="H3303"\w*: from the \w sole|strong="H3709"\w* of his \w foot|strong="H7272"\w* even to the crown of his \w head|strong="H6936"\w* there was no \w blemish|strong="H3971"\w* in him.\f + \fr 14.25 \ft But…: Heb. And as Absalom there was not a beautiful man in all Israel to praise greatly\f*

And when he \w polled|strong="H1548"\w* his \w head|strong="H7218"\w*, (for it was at every \w year’s|strong="H3117"\w* \w end|strong="H7093"\w* that he \w polled|strong="H1548"\w* \add it:\add* because \add the hair\add* was \w heavy|strong="H3513"\w* on him, therefore he \w polled|strong="H1548"\w* it:) he \w weighed|strong="H8254"\w* the \w hair|strong="H8181"\w* of his \w head|strong="H7218"\w* at two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w* \w shekels|strong="H8255"\w* after the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w weight|strong="H0068"\w*.

And unto \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* there were \w born|strong="H3205"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w sons|strong="H1121"\w*, and \w one|strong="H0259"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w*, whose \w name|strong="H8034"\w* \add was\add* \w Tamar|strong="H8559"\w*: she was a \w woman|strong="H0802"\w* of a \w fair|strong="H3303"\w* \w countenance|strong="H4758"\w*.

¶ So \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w dwelt|strong="H3427"\w* two \w full|strong="H3117"\w* \w years|strong="H8141"\w* in \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, and \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* not the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w face|strong="H6440"\w*.

Therefore \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* for \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, to have \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* him to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*; but he \w would|strong="H0014"\w* not \w come|strong="H0935"\w* to him: and when he sent \w again|strong="H7971"\w* the second \w time|strong="H8145"\w*, he \w would|strong="H0014"\w* not \w come|strong="H0935"\w*.

Therefore he \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, \w See|strong="H7200"\w*, \w Joab’s|strong="H3097"\w* \w field|strong="H2513"\w* is \w near|strong="H0413"\w* \w mine|strong="H3027"\w*, and he hath \w barley|strong="H8184"\w* there; \w go|strong="H3212"\w* and \w set|strong="H3341"\w* it on \w fire|strong="H0784"\w*. And \w Absalom’s|strong="H0053"\w* \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w set|strong="H3341"\w* the \w field|strong="H2513"\w* on \w fire|strong="H0784"\w*.\f + \fr 14.30 \ft near…: Heb. near my place\f*

Then \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w arose|strong="H6965"\w*, and \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* unto \add his\add* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, Wherefore have thy \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* \w set|strong="H3341"\w* my \w field|strong="H2513"\w* on \w fire|strong="H0784"\w*?

And \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w answered|strong="H0559"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, Behold, I \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* unto thee, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Come|strong="H0935"\w* hither, that I may \w send|strong="H7971"\w* thee to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, to \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, Wherefore am I \w come|strong="H0935"\w* from \w Geshur|strong="H1650"\w*? \add it had been\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w* for me \add to have been\add* there still: now therefore let me \w see|strong="H7200"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w face|strong="H6440"\w*; and if there \w be|strong="H3426"\w* \add any\add* \w iniquity|strong="H5771"\w* in me, let him \w kill|strong="H4191"\w* me.

So \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w told|strong="H5046"\w* him: and when he had \w called|strong="H7121"\w* for \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, he \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w bowed|strong="H7812"\w* himself on his \w face|strong="H0639"\w* to the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*: and the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w kissed|strong="H5401"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*.
